content.raw:
when I gave the yellow submarine's `spinning_joint` a high torque, e.g. 5000, it went forward but became unstable and gazebo eventually crashed with this error:

~~~
***** Internal Program Error - assertion (cosAlpha <= 1) failed in virtual void gazebo::LiftDragPlugin::OnUpdate():
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo2/plugins/LiftDragPlugin.cc(191): cosAlpha greater than domain for arccos!
~~~

Maybe I'm doing something I'm not supposed to? but it would nice to prevent the crash
content.html:
when I gave the yellow submarine's spinning_joint a high torque, e.g. 5000, it went forward but became unstable and gazebo eventually crashed with this error:

***** Internal Program Error - assertion (cosAlpha <= 1) failed in virtual void gazebo::LiftDragPlugin::OnUpdate():
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo2/plugins/LiftDragPlugin.cc(191): cosAlpha greater than domain for arccos!

Maybe I'm doing something I'm not supposed to? but it would nice to prevent the crash

content.raw:
yeah, 5000 newton meters is a lot!

It's a bit crude, but I've changed the GZ_ASSERTs to set the value of `cosAlpha` to well within the domain of arccos if it's over. Let me know if you still see the crash.
content.html:
yeah, 5000 newton meters is a lot!

It's a bit crude, but I've changed the GZ_ASSERTs to set the value of cosAlpha to well within the domain of arccos if it's over. Let me know if you still see the crash.

content.raw: Default value of id here is -1, I can not understand why. There is a chance that is the linkElem does not have a name, this -1 ends up as the index of the map in the assignations of lines 73 and 79. Is this a valid case and are we considering the consequences of having a map with a -1 entry?
content.html: Default value of id here is -1, I can not understand why. There is a chance that is the linkElem does not have a name, this -1 ends up as the index of the map in the assignations of lines 73 and 79. Is this a valid case and are we considering the consequences of having a map with a -1 entry?

content.raw:
I tried to do the simplest things to make this safe in 111e410.

I added checks for each element/attribute and exit if one of the elements is missing, leaving no trace of the ID in the map. I also check if the ID has already been added to the map and simply skip it if it has.

I could add more documentation about this behavior if needed.
content.html:
I tried to do the simplest things to make this safe in 111e410.

I added checks for each element/attribute and exit if one of the elements is missing, leaving no trace of the ID in the map. I also check if the ID has already been added to the map and simply skip it if it has.

I could add more documentation about this behavior if needed.

content.raw: Thanks for the fix. It is fine for me now.
content.html: Thanks for the fix. It is fine for me now.

content.raw: Since we have real code in the Load method, maybe we can add a quick description about what is going to happen when loading the plugin? (compute the center of volume, density, ...)
content.html: Since we have real code in the Load method, maybe we can add a quick description about what is going to happen when loading the plugin? (compute the center of volume, density, ...)

content.raw:
111e410 I've added checks that only a positive, non-zero number can be added for volume. I can't think of any great checks on center of volume, however.

Maybe to be extra safe I could check if the center of volume is outside of the link's bounding box, but it's not 100% accurate.
content.html:
111e410 I've added checks that only a positive, non-zero number can be added for volume. I can't think of any great checks on center of volume, however.

Maybe to be extra safe I could check if the center of volume is outside of the link's bounding box, but it's not 100% accurate.

content.raw:
thanks! this kind of checks usually helps a lot when a user (or us) made errors with the physics parameters.

I would say, in the case of not being totally sure about an error but most of the chances will mean that, could be enough to just use gzWarn so we have somewhat a hint about the problem.
